reviews.sentence: Long Island Gem. My family stayed. the Melville Mariot for a Winter Blues fix and it surely did the trick. A welcoming front desk especially Harmony start you off in a positive and welcoming way. Susan. Food Services goes above and beyond and makes you feel like family. and always the can do attitude. Mohammed. the pool was terrific with the kids and in keeping the pool clean and warm as you looked out the big windows to huge snow drifts. The hotel food was very good nice atmosphere with Adriana and Maria wonderful with the kids and so sincere professional in their work. It was sad to leave but we were refreshed by a great get a way.

Good for big chain hotel. Spent one night here in April 2015. The room looked newly renovated it was well designed and very clean. Staff are friendly and helpful. I would happily stay here again if I were in the area. One thing I did notice about the bathroom is that the shower grouting was completely stained. As the room bathroom were immaculate I suspect the problem was with the grouting caulking itself that mold seeped underneath and stained it. As for room selection patrons should know that many of the rooms overlook the giant atrium in the middle of the hotel. This is nice however there are public walkways that run in between these rooms which have large sliding glass doors and the balcony. This would be a huge privacy issue for me despite the curtains on the glass doors so I was glad I had a room along the exterior wall of the hotel.

Not bad for meetings. The hotel is currently being updated renovated in the public spaces but I have stayed here before. It certainly needs to be updated. The format is an atrium style internal with a large open area. There is a pool and a gym at one end and reception at the other. Service at the bar is always nice but I have only ever eaten breakfast in the hotel which is very standard fare. The rooms are functional but nothing to get excited about. There are several large meeting rooms which are useful for a corporate get together. Overall it does the job and covers one of the larger meeting spaces in the area. If you have kids the pool is ok but bear in mind it is inside and open not closed off.

I love NY. They were renovating in the lobby during normal business hours which was kind of inconvience it would of been better to do during night or evening hours. Bathroom was very very small but besides that room was clean. Staff was very nice.

HIghly recommended even with renovations. I stayed at this hotel on a business trip for two weeks in June and I really have no complaints at all. Before I begin my review I should mention that like some reviewers have pointed out the lobby is currently under renovation but I certainly could not tell. This is a commercial entity so no one should except the hotel to close for cosmetic renovations. I stayed on the second floor and woke up one morning to find the front desk had been moved completely. There was not any noise factor whatsoever throughout my stay not unles you count the guests yelling with excitement during the NBA finals game 1 and 2. There was also one night when an Indian wedding was held there so there were a few noisy guests talking as they walked to their rooms. But that is not the hotels fault. They were not really loud anyway. The actual wedding venue was not noisy at all. I had a single king size bed in my room and plenty of space to put away the few things I needed to feel at home for two weeks. There is not a microwave in each room but I requested one and was given one for my room. The bathroom is a bit small but I did not mind it too much especially since I got a really functional restroom powerful water pressure from the shower and in the toilet. The cleaning service is quite superior as well. I typically do not have my room cleaned on a daily basis but after four days of hanging my privacy card on the door I found a basket with fresh towels and toiletries to replace what I had used. Other hotels I have stayed at do not even bother with it or throw it into a trash bag. The cleaning ladies were very efficient. Overall the service was exceptional considering there was tons of traffic in and out of the building besides the wedding there was also a college recruitment convention and a few other business meetings. Two staff members I enjoyed interacting with because they were very pleasant courteous and professional. Bridget front desk and Sep front desk are great members of staff to engage in conversations with. Sep also drove me a few times to nearby restaurants and stores to get food and gave me good options on what restaurants to visit. I left for work really early so I am not sure if this service is available daily but I do know on weekends there is a chef on site to make you an omelet and waffles to order. The breakfast buffet is pretty good as well. The hotel has one of the best gyms out there. There are at least 5 treadmills and 3 elliptical machines. Tons of weights multi purpose weight machine ear phones if you need and fitness balls. The pool is indoors within the courtyard and also got a lot of usage during my stay though I never tried it. The only thing I found odd was the sliding door which opened up to the corridor facing the courtyard. I like to open up my blinds in the day time to get some natural light but it was very awkward doing that knowing anyone walking by could look right in. But that was hardly an issue for me. If you are looking for a hotel to stay on a visit to the city this might be too far for you from the likes of Times Square or Central Park but if you are in the Long Island area or do not mind taking a train from Huntington Station the hotel shuttle can drop and pick you up from here to Penn Station in Manhattan then I recommend giving this hotel a try. Note that the Wifi is only free if you a member of the Rewards program which you can easily join at check in. On site packing is free as weldo not forget to ask for Sep if you need a more personalized help.

Terrible. This hotel is beat. Yes the lobby has been renovated but the rooms are disgusting. Filthy. I can not believe Mariot has their name on this hotel. I asked for a renovated room and they do not have any. There are other options for hotesl near here. do not stay here until Mariot decides to invest and clean it up.

Friendly staff with everything you need. I was here for a one week business trip. This hotel is busy and very large. You will always see someone sitting at the bar area or having dinner right next to it. I enjoyed their fitness center with their plethora of cardio equipment resistance cables free weights and spacious matting for yoga and stretching. I was in an isolated corner but the back of the room was a sliding glass door enabling me to walk out facing the atrium. I think all of the rooms have the same amenity. The hotel shuttle runs until 11 pm and can take you within a 2 mile radius. I did not have a car for the week so the shuttle was very helpful. I enjoyed the salads from the restaurant and their breakfast was very good. Most of all I really appreciated the top notch service every single staff member provided as I felt like I was staying at a 5 star resort. There was construction still going on during my stay and I had an older room that needed a facelift. Besides that this is a great location to stay for business or a weekend getaway. Highly recommended.

Great Staff. I stayed at the melville mariot a couple of weeks ago They where doing a large renovation but it was looking really good. The staff where amazing Tim helped me when I arrived with getting my room. Jade was great giving me directions on how to get into the city. When I was at the bar Gary and I think his name was Chris where awesome and friendly. Overall everyone went out of their way to help us. Rooms could do we a little updating.

Great Staff. I stayed at the melville mariot a couple of weeks ago They where doing a large renovation but it was looking really good. The staff where amazing Tim helped me when I arrived with getting my room. Jade was great giving me directions on how to get into the city. When I was at the bar Gary and I think his name was Chris where awesome and friendly. Overall everyone went out of their way to help us. Rooms could do we a little updating.

Excellent Customer Service. I stay at the Melville Mariot often. The customer service is without a doubt best in class. From the doorman to the front desk to the staff at the restaurant everyone is especially friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend staying at the Mariot Melville. At a minimum I would suggest you try the newly renovated restaurant and M Lounge. Ask for Julia. She is Excellent.

Welcoming and accommodating. My family arrived after a long day of travel. We needed one room that was ADA accessible in addition to a double and Tia checked us in and found rooms across the hall from each other which made it much easier with three generations traveling together. She was lovely and friendly and even sent snacks to our room for our children. My daughter said she felt like she was a celebrity with the treatment. Rooms are updated and the public space is bright and modern.

Staycation. Planned an overnight with another family to escape the dreary New York winter. We were so pleasantly surprised. Many renovations and the pool area was very clean. Staff was kind and accommodating. Do not hesitate to stay here.

Nice hotel but bring your walking shoes. Stayed 1 night while seeing a show at nearby NYCB Theater. The hotel was renovated recently in the first floor lobby area. I was here last year meeting friends for drinks and it looked completely different. Nice upscale new hotel feeling. Bar area is a lot smaller and is adjacent within the restaurant area. Room was very clean comforta6ble. Mattress and pillows were great granite bathroom counter. Liked the decor of the restaurant. Had appetizers with drinks after the show. Appetizers were so so. Had breakfast brunch Saturday morning for about 20 with a lot of options. I do not think a menu is even offered. My room was quiet. I could see how some people would be unhappy if your room overlooked the indoor pool and lobby area especially if there was a wedding with music. This is a big hotel and a lot of walking is involved. Paid 1800 for a Friday night.

The hallway carpet is right out of the 1980s. The hotel is very unusual on how it is laid out very long hallways confusing room signage open spaces toward the workout area that do not make sense. Half the lobby area has been updated bar counter and work center looks nice. REPLACE THE HALLWAY CARPET. The rooms are fresh clean new bedding and somewhat modernized. The staff is very helpful request a top floor room far away from the open atrium area. Overall I will return nice option.

Five Plus Rating. The Mariot Melville is the absolute best among all hotels in its class bar none. Our recent stay was incredible. Rooms decor restaurant all superior. But their best quality was the friendliness and competency of the staff. All were top notch the front desk housekeeping restaurant maintenance workers everyone. We will make the Mariot Melville the destination for our annual family stay on Long Island.
Nice hotel. Rooms are just starting to be renovated. I am sure this will be an awesome place after the renovation is complete.

Great hotel. with amazing staff. A great recently remodeled hotel. The staff is truly amazing. All around. from the front door welcome to the restaurant M club housekeeping and maintenance. Truly impressive warm friendly accommodating. Wish they were all like this one.

Beautifully renovated property with exceptionally friendly staff. If you ’re staying here on weekends though beware the atrium echoes loudly into the rooms. Many rooms face this atrium and have retro read thin interior sliding glass doors and the weekend wedding crowds screaming and yelling well into the 330 4 AM hour made sleep difficult despite the hotel ’s best efforts to contain them. Better soundproofing or complimentary earbuds would help. Staff was really apologetic and understanding when I mentioned it and put points on my account to apologize without having to asking which was impressive. During the week I imagine this location is much more quiet would recommend.
It is an older hotel that has been updated. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Excellent and very nice updated Mariot. This is a fantastic Mariot. I am a lifelong Titanium member so I know my Mariots. This place is pricy though and the restaurant is wonderful but again very pricey. for example 2 beers at the bar and that was 25. However if I am in that area again I would for sure stay here as the rooms as extremely nice. Highly recommended.
